meanings.definition: A species of grapevine native to the Mediterranean region.
meanings.sent1: The vinifera grows well in warm climates.
meanings.sent2: Winemakers use vinifera to produce different types of wine.
meanings.sent3: The vinifera at the party was the life of the vineyard!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter spread through the room like a vinifera in full bloom.
meanings.sent5: The sweet scent of vinifera filled the air, inviting all to taste its fruit.

meanings.definition: The fruit of the grapevine, used for making wine.
meanings.sent1: I picked some ripe vinifera for our winemaking.
meanings.sent2: The vineyard was full of clusters of vinifera ready for harvest.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient was a dash of vinifera in every dish.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as refreshing as a glass of chilled vinifera.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of vinifera filled the cellar, promising a delightful vintage.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the grapevine species Vitis vinifera.
meanings.sent1: The vinifera vines in the garden were thriving.
meanings.sent2: The winery specialized in producing vinifera wines.
meanings.sent3: The cat fancied itself a vinifera connoisseur, always near the vines.
meanings.sent4: His words were as smooth and rich as a glass of vinifera wine.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky in hues reminiscent of vinifera leaves in autumn.
